description: Airing on Tuesday, April 7, 2015: First up on today's show, we'll talk with James McQuivey, Analyst at Forrester, on Hulu’s new GIF search engine and how video clips spread online. Plus, John McDuling, reporter at Quartz, stops by to talk about how high-priced shows like Mad Men drove Netflix to create original programming. We'll also chat with Rose Scott, reporter from WABE in Georgia, about how big data analytics tipped off state officials about coordinated cheating in Atlanta Public Schools.

title: Marketplace Tech for Tuesday, April 7, 2015
